intro: Anthriscus vulgaris var. crassus, commonly known as broad-leaved cow parsley, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its large, fern-like leaves and white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbels. Native to Europe, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. The plant has a hollow, ridged stem and is often mistaken for other members of the parsley family. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically valuable species in its native habitat.
